sorcer.service

Interface Signature

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Arg, Comparable, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AntSignature, EvaluationSignature, NetSignature, ObjectSignature, ServiceSignature

    public interface Signature
extends Serializable, Comparable, Arg
    A service Signature is an indirect behavioral feature of Exertions that declares a service that can be performed by instances of Services. It contains a service type and a selector of operation of that service type (interface). Its implicit parameter and return value is a service Context. Thus, the explicit signature of service-oriented operations is defined by the same Context type for any exertion parameter and return value . A signature may include a collection of optional attributes describing a preferred Service with a given service type. Also a signature can carry own implementation when its type is implemented with the provided codebase.

    In other words, a service signature is a specification of a service that can be requested dynamically at the boundary of a service provider. Operations include modifying a service Context or disclosing information about the service context.

    Author:
    Mike Sobolewski

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Signature.Direction 
      static class  Signature.Kind 
      static class  Signature.ReturnPath<T> 
      static class  Signature.Type
      There are four types of Signature operations that can be associated with signatures: PRE (preprocess), SRV (process/service) , POST (postprocess), and APD_DATA (append data) and code>APD_CONTROL (append control strategy).

      • getCodebase

        String getCodebase()
        Returns a codebase for the code implementing this signature. The codebase is a space separated string (list) of URls.
        Returns:
        a codebase for the code implementing this signature

      • setCodebase

        void setCodebase(String urls)
        Assigns a codbase to urls for the code implementing this signature. The codebase is a space separated string (list) of URls.
        Parameters:
        urls - a list of space separated URLS
